item.text: SECTION B. Intake and Initial History
1. Level of control person had over decision to move into LTCF
b. Indigenous status - Is the client of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander origin?
6. Post code of usual living arrangement prior to admission
a. Long-term care facility - e.g., nursing home, chronic sick unit
b. Board and care home, assisted living, group home
c. Mental health residence - e.g., psychiatric group home
e. Setting for persons with intellectual disability
1. Cognitive skills for daily decision making

valueCoding.display: Modified independence-some difficulty in new situations only

item.text: a. Short-term memory OK-Seems / appears to recall after 5 minutes
b. Procedural memory OK-Can perform all or almost all steps in a multitask sequence without cues
c. Situational memory OK- Both: recognizes caregiver's names / faces frequently encountered AND knows location of places regularly visited  (bedroom, dining room, activity, therapy room)
d. Long-term memory OK-Seems / appears to recall distant past
a. Easily distracted-e.g., episodes of difficulty paying attention; gets sidetracked

valueCoding.display: Behaviour present, consistent with usual functioning

item.text: b. Episodes of disorganized speech-e.g., speech is nonsensical, irrelevant, or rambling from subject to subject; loses train of thought
c. Mental Function varies over the course of the day-e.g., sometimes better, sometimes worse
4. Acute change in mental status from person's usual functioning - e.g., restlessness, lethargy, difficult to arouse, altered environmental perception
5. Change in decision making as compared to 90 days ago (or since last assessment)

valueCoding.display: 1. Usually understood — Difficulty finding words or finishing thoughts BUT if given time, little or no prompting required
3. Sometimes understands — Responds adequately to simple, direct communication only

item.text: a. Ability to hear (with hearing appliance normally used)

valueCoding.display: 1. Minimal difficulty — Difficulty in some environments (e.g., when person speaks softly or is more than 6 feet [2 meters] away)

item.text: a. Ability to see in adequate light (with glasses or with other appliance normally used)

valueCoding.display: 1. Minimal difficulty — Sees large print but not regular print in newspapers / books

item.text: 1. Indicators of possible depressed, anxious, or sad mood
a. Made negative statements - e.g., "Nothing matters"; "Would rather be dead"; "What's the use"; "Regret having lived so long"; "Let me die"

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: b. Persistent anger with self or others - e.g., easily annoyed, anger at care received
c. Expressions, including non-verbal, of what appears to be unrealistic fears - e.g., fear of being abandoned, being left alone, being with others, intense fear of specific objects or situations
d. Repetitive health complaints - e.g., persistently seeks medical attention, incessant concern with body functions
e. Repetitive anxious complaints/concerns (non-health-related) - e.g., persistently seeks attention/reassurance regarding schedules, meals, laundry, clothing, relationships

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: f. Sad, pained, or worried facial expressions - e.g., furrowed brow, constant frowning

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: h. Recurrent statements that something terrible is about to happen - e.g., believes he or she is about to die, have a heart attack
i. Withdrawal from activities of interest - e.g., long-standing activities, being with family/friends

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: k. Expressions, including non-verbal, of a lack of pleasure in life (anhedonia) - e.g., "I don’t enjoy anything anymore"
2. Self-reported mood - "In the last 3 days, how often have you felt…"
a. Little interest or pleasure in things you normally enjoy?

valueCoding.display: 1. Not in last 3 days but often feels that way

item.text: a. Wandering - Moved with no rational purpose, seemingly oblivious to needs or safety

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: b. Verbal abuse - e.g., others were threatened, screamed at, cursed at
c. Physical abuse - e.g., others were hit, shoved, scratched, sexually abused

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: d. Socially inappropriate or disruptive behaviour - e.g., made disruptive sounds or noise, screamed out, smeared or threw food or faeces, hoarded, rummaged through other's belongings
e. Inappropriate public sexual behaviour or public disrobing

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: f. Resists care - e.g., taking medications/injections, ADL assistance, eating
a. Participation in social activities of long-standing interest
b. Visit with a long-standing social relation or family member
c. Other interaction with long-standing social relation or family member - e.g., telephone, e-mail
a. At ease interacting with others

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: b. At ease doing planned or structured activities
c. Accepts invitations into most group activities
d. Pursues involvement in life of facility - e.g., makes or keeps friends; involved in group activities; responds positively to new activities; assists at religious services

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: f. Reacts positively to interactions initiated by others
g. Adjusts easily to change in routine
a. Conflict with or repeated criticism of other care recipients
b. Conflict with or repeated criticism of staff
c. Staff report persistent frustration in dealing with person
d. Family or close friends report feeling overwhelmed by person’s condition
e. Says or indicates that he/she feels lonely

4. Major life stressors in the last 90 days - e.g., episode of severe personal illness; death or severe illness of close famiy member/friend; loss of home; major loss of income/assets; victim of a crime such as a robbery or assualt; loss of driving licence/car
b. Finds meaning in day-to-day life
c. Strong and supportive relationship with family

a. Bathing - How takes a full-body bath/shower. Includes how transfers in and out of tub or shower AND how each part of the body is bathed: arms, upper and lower legs, chest, abdomen, perineal area-EXCLUDE WASHING OF BACK AND HAIR

valueCoding.display: 1. Independent, setup help only — Article or device provided or placed within reach, no physical assistance or supervision in any episode

item.text: b. Personal hygiene - How manages personal hygiene, including combing hair, brushing teeth, shaving, applying make-up, washing ad drying face and hands - EXCLUDES BATHS AND SHOWERS

valueCoding.display: 1. Independent, setup help only — Article or device provided or placed within reach, no physical assistance or supervision in any episode

item.text: c. Dressing upper body - How dresses and undresses  (street clothes, underwear) from above the waist, including prostheses, orthotics, fasteners, pullovers, etc.

valueCoding.display: 6. Total dependence — Full performance by others during all episodes

item.text: d. Dressing lower body - How dresses and undresses (street clothes and underwear) from the waist down, including protheses, orthotics, belts, pants, skirts, shoes, fasteners, etc.

valueCoding.display: 1. Independent, setup help only — Article or device provided or placed within reach, no physical assistance or supervision in any episode

item.text: e. Walking - How walks between locations on same floor indoors

valueCoding.display: 6. Total dependence — Full performance by others during all episodes

item.text: f. Locomotion - How moves between locations on same floor (walking or wheeling). If in wheelchair, self-sufficiency once in chair
g. Transfer toilet - How moves on and off toilet or commode

valueCoding.display: 4. Extensive assistance — Weight-bearing support (including lifting limbs) by 1 helper where person still performs 50% or more of subtasks

item.text: h. Toilet use - How uses the toilet room (or commode, bedpan, urinal), cleanses self after toilet use or incontinent episode(s), changes pad, manages ostomy or catheter, adjusts clothes - EXCLUDE TRANSFER ON AND OFF TOILET

valueCoding.display: 1. Independent, setup help only — Article or device provided or placed within reach, no physical assistance or supervision in any episode

item.text: i. Bed mobility - How moves to and from lying position, turns from side to side, and positions body while in bed
j. Eating - How eats and drinks (regardless of skill). Includes intake of nourishment by other means (e.g., tube feeding, total parenteral nutrition)

valueCoding.display: 8. Activity did not occur during entire period

item.text: c. Distance walked - Farthest distance walked at one time without sitting down in the LAST 3 DAYS (with support as needed)
d. Distance wheeled self - Farthest distance wheeled self at one time in the LAST 3 DAYS (includes independent use of motorised wheelchair)

valueCoding.display: 2. Wheeled self less than 15 feet (under 5 metres)

item.text: a. Total hours of exercise or physical activity in Last 3 days
b. In the LAST 3 DAYS, number of days went out of house or building in which he/she resides (no matter how short the period)
a. Person believes he/she is capable of improved performance in physical function
b. Care professional believes person is capable of improved performance in physical function
5. Change in ADL status as compared to 90 days ago (or since last assessment if less than 90 days ago)

valueCoding.display: 4. Frequently incontinent — Daily, but some control present

item.text: a. Hip fracture during the last 30 days (or since last assessment if less than 30 days)
b. Other fracture during the last 30 days (or since last assessment if less than 30 days)

valueCoding.display: 1. Primary diagnosis / diagnoses for current stay

item.text: d. Dementia other than Alzheimer's disease

valueCoding.display: 1. Primary diagnosis / diagnoses for current stay
3. Diagnosis present, monitored but no active treatment
3. Diagnosis present, monitored but no active treatment

1. Primary diagnosis / diagnoses for current stay
3. Diagnosis present, monitored but no active treatment
1. Primary diagnosis / diagnoses for current stay

item.text: s. Urinary tract infection (UTI) during last 30 days

valueCoding.display: 1. Primary diagnosis / diagnoses for current stay
3. Diagnosis present, monitored but no active treatment
1. No fall in the last 30 days, but fell 31-90 days ago

item.text: a. Difficult or unable to move self to standing position unassisted

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: b. Difficult or unable to turn self around and face the opposite direction when standing

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: g. Abnormal thought process - e.g., loosening of associations, blocking, flight of ideas, tangentiality, circumstantiality

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: k. Acid reflux - Regurgitation of acid from stomach to throat

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days

item.text: l. Constipation - No bowel movement in 3 days or difficult passage of hard stool
o. Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep; waking up too early; restless- ness; non-restful sleep
p. Too much sleep - Excessive amount of sleep that interferes with person’s normal functioning

valueCoding.display: 1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days
1. Present but not exhibited in last 3 days
1. Absent at rest but present when performed moderate activities
1. Minimal — Diminished energy but completes normal day-to-day activities

item.text: a. Frequency with which person complains or shows evidence of pain (including grimacing, teeth clenching, moaning, withdrawal when touched, or other non-verbal signs suggesting pain)
b. Intensity of highest level of pain present
d. Breakthrough pain - Times in LAST 3 DAYS when person experienced sudden, acute flare-ups of pain
e. Pain control - Adequacy of current therapeutic regimen to control pain (from person's point of view)
a. Conditions/diseases make cognitive, AD, mood, or behaviour patterns unstable
b. Experiencing an acute episode or flare up of a recurrent or chronic problem
c. End-stage disease, 6 or fewer months to live

valueCoding.display: 1. Not in last 3 days but is usually a daily smoker

item.text: b. Alcohol-Highest number of drinks in any 'single sitting' in LAST 14 DAYS
SECTION K. Oral and Nutritional Status
a. Weight loss of 5% or more in LAST 30 DAYS, or 10% or more in LAST 180 DAYS
c. Fluid intake less than 1,000ml per day

valueCoding.display: 7. Abdominal feeding tube only — e.g., PEG tube
1. Parenteral / enteral tube, but no caloric intake

item.text: b. Has broken, fragmented, loose, or otherwise nonintact natural teeth
c. Reports mouth or facial pain / discomfort
f. Presents with gum (soft tissue) inflammation or bleeding adjacent to natural teeth or tooth fragments

valueCoding.display: 1. Any area of persistent skin redness

item.text: 3. Presence of skin ulcer other than pressure ulcer
4. Major skin problems-e.g., lesions, 2nd- or 3rd-degree burns, healing surgical wounds
5. Skin tears or cuts - other than surgery
6. Other skin conditions or changes in skin condition - e.g., bruises, rashes, itching, mottling, herpes zoster, intertrigo, eczema
7. Foot problems - e.g., bunions, hammertoes, overlapping toes, structural problems, infections, ulcers
1. Average time involved in activities - e.g., alone, in social group
c. Conversing or talking on the phone

item.text: f. Discussing or Reminiscing about life

valueCoding.display: 3. Preferred, regularly involved but not in last 3 days
3. Preferred, regularly involved but not in last 3 days
3. Preferred, regularly involved but not in last 3 days

item.text: l. Reading, writing, or crossword puzzles

valueCoding.display: 1. No preference, involved in last 3 days
1. No preference, involved in last 3 days
1. No preference, involved in last 3 days

item.text: p. Watching television, listening to radio, listening to music

valueCoding.display: 2. Asleep most of the time, but some periods awake and alert (e.g., at meals)

item.text: b. Dose - A positive number such as 0.5, 5, 150, 300.
c. Unit - Code using the following list:
d. Route of administration - Code using the following list:
e. Frequency - Code the number of times per day, week, or month the medication is administered using the following list:
b. Dose - A positive number such as 0.5, 5, 150, 300.
c. Unit - Code using the following list:
d. Route of administration - Code using the following list:
e. Frequency - Code the number of times per day, week, or month the medication is administered using the following list:
a. Blood pressure measured in LAST YEAR
b. Colonoscopy test in LAST 5 YEARS
c. Dental exam in LAST YEAR
d. Eye exam in LAST YEAR
e. Hearing exam in LAST 2 YEARS
f. Influenza vaccine in LAST YEAR
g. Mammogram or breast exam in LAST 2 YEARS (for women)
h. Pneumovax vaccine in LAST 5 YEARS or after age 65
2. Therapy/Nursing services in last 7 days - e.g., therapist or therapy assistant under direction of therapist

valueCoding.display: 0. Not ordered AND did not occur

item.text: c. Infection control — e.g., isolation, quarantine

item.text: m. Palliative care for chronic conditions
3. Therapy/Nursing services in last 7 days - e.g., therapist or therapy assistant under direction of therapist
Physical therapy - Number of days treatment scheduled in the LAST 7 DAYS
Physical therapy - Number of days treatment administered for 15 minutes or more
Physical therapy - Total number of minutes provided in LAST 7 DAYS (or ordered if days administered = 0 and days scheduled > 0)
Occupational therapy - Number of days treatment scheduled in the LAST 7 DAYS
Occupational therapy - Number of days treatment administered for 15 minutes or more
Occupational therapy - Total number of minutes provided in LAST 7 DAYS (or ordered if days administered = 0 and days scheduled > 0)
c. Speech-Language Therapy and Audiology Services
Speech-language pathology and audiology services - Number of days treatment scheduled in the LAST 7 DAYS
Speech-Language Therapy and Audiology Services - Number of days treatment administered for 15 minutes or more
Speech-Language Therapy and Audiology Services - Total number of minutes provided in LAST 7 DAYS (or ordered if days administered = 0 and days scheduled > 0)
Respiratory therapy - Number of days treatment scheduled in the LAST 7 DAYS
Respiratory therapy - Number of days treatment administered for 15 minutes or more
Respiratory therapy - Total number of minutes provided in LAST 7 DAYS (or ordered if days administered = 0 and days scheduled > 0)
e. Functional rehabilitation or walking program by licensed nurse
Functional rehabilitation - Number of days treatment scheduled in the LAST 7 DAYS
Functional rehabilitation - Number of days treatment administered for 15 minutes or more
Functional rehabilitation - Total number of minutes provided in LAST 7 DAYS (or ordered if days administered = 0 and days scheduled > 0)
Psychological therapies - Number of days treatment scheduled in the LAST 7 DAYS
Psychological therapies - Number of days treatment administered for 15 minutes or more
Psychological therapies - Total number of minutes provided in LAST 7 DAYS (or ordered if days administered = 0 and days scheduled > 0)

b. Emergency room / department visit (not counting overnight stay)

b. Advance directives for not intubating
